english_translation: From Ibn Jurayj, from Ata', regarding His saying, Mighty and Majestic: "From their vegetables, cucumbers, and wheat" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:61), it is said: Wheat is bread. And the Sabians: Between the Jews and Magians there is no religion for them. Regarding His saying: "And an admonition for the pious" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:66), it is said: For the Ummah of Muhammad ﷺ. Regarding His saying, Mighty and Majestic: "Neither worn-out nor virgin, of an age between those two" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:68), said: Worn-out is mature, virgin is young, and of an age between is she who has given birth once or twice. He said: Between those two. Regarding His saying: "A yellow cow, bright in color" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:69), radiant, exceedingly yellow. Regarding His saying: "Without any blemish on it" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:71), it is said: There is no color or mark on it. Regarding His saying: "Whoever commits an evil deed" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:81), it is said: Associating partners with Allah. "And his sin has encircled him" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:81), it is said: Every deed that has made the Fire obligatory upon him. The companions of Abdullah used to recite it: "And speak to the people kindly." Regarding His saying: "You will surely find them clinging most greedily to life" (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:96), it is said: The Jews.
